verses.kjv: And David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.
verses.web: David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.
verses.ct: David met with his commanders over thousands and hundreds — every officer in his army.

verses.kjv: And David said unto all the congregation of Israel, If it seem good unto you, and that it be of the LORD our God, let us send abroad unto our brethren every where, that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites which are in their cities and suburbs, that they may gather themselves unto us:
verses.web: David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is of LORD our God, let’s send word everywhere to our brothers who are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have pasture lands, that they may gather themselves to us.
verses.ct: David addressed the whole assembly of Israel: "If you agree, and if the LORD our God is behind this, let's send word to all our fellow Israelites throughout the land — including the priests and Levites in their towns and pasturelands — and invite them to join us.

verses.kjv: And let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we enquired not at it in the days of Saul.
verses.web: Also, let’s bring the ark of our God back to us again; for we didn’t seek it in the days of Saul.”
verses.ct: Let's bring the ark of our God back to us, because we neglected it during Saul's reign."

verses.kjv: And all the congregation said that they would do so: for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
verses.web: All the assembly said that they would do so; for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
verses.ct: The entire assembly agreed to do it, because everyone thought it was the right thing to do.

verses.kjv: So David gathered all Israel together, from Shihor of Egypt even unto the entering of Hemath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjathjearim.
verses.web: So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor the brook of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring God’s ark from Kiriath Jearim.
verses.ct: So David assembled all of Israel, from the Shihor River on the Egyptian border all the way to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.

verses.kjv: And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjathjearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up thence the ark of God the LORD, that dwelleth between the cherubims, whose name is called on it.
verses.web: David went up with all Israel to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there God LORD’s ark that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.
verses.ct: David and all Israel traveled to Baalah (that is, Kiriath Jearim) in the territory of Judah, to bring back the ark of God the LORD — the ark over which his name is proclaimed, where he is enthroned between the cherubim.

verses.kjv: And they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drave the cart.
verses.web: They carried God’s ark on a new cart, and brought it out of Abinadab’s house; and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
verses.ct: They loaded the ark of God onto a new cart and brought it out of Abinadab's house, with Uzza and Ahio guiding the cart.

verses.kjv: And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
verses.web: David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, with harps, with stringed instruments, with tambourines, with cymbals, and with trumpets.
verses.ct: David and all Israel celebrated before God with everything they had — singing and playing harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

verses.kjv: And when they came unto the threshingfloor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
verses.web: When they came to Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
verses.ct: But when they reached the threshing floor of Chidon, the oxen stumbled, and Uzza reached out his hand to steady the ark.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put his hand to the ark: and there he died before God.
verses.web: LORD’s anger burned against Uzza, and he struck him, because he put his hand on the ark; and he died there before God.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger blazed against Uzza, and God struck him down because he had touched the ark. Uzza died right there in God's presence.

verses.kjv: And David was displeased, because the LORD had made a breach upon Uzza: wherefore that place is called Perezuzza to this day.
verses.web: David was displeased, because LORD had broken out against Uzza. He called that place Perez Uzza, to this day.
verses.ct: David was upset that the LORD had lashed out against Uzza. He named that place Perez Uzza, and it's still called that today.

verses.kjv: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
verses.web: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring God’s ark home to me?”
verses.ct: David was afraid of God that day. "How can I possibly bring the ark of God home to me?" he said.

verses.kjv: So David brought not the ark home to himself to the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obededom the Gittite.
verses.web: So David didn’t move the ark with him into David’s city, but carried it aside into Obed-Edom the Gittite’s house.
verses.ct: So instead of bringing the ark into the city of David, he had it taken to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

verses.kjv: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obededom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the house of Obededom, and all that he had.
verses.web: God’s ark remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months; and LORD blessed Obed-Edom’s house and all that he had.
verses.ct: The ark of God stayed with Obed-edom's family in his house for 3 months, and the LORD blessed Obed-edom's household and everything he owned.
